comments.body: Couldn't you keep the namespaces until the end? That would save you to use long names like: `ROOT::Experimental::TCanvasPainter` every time

It is like @Axel-Naumann is doing in all other parts of v7 code.
On the long run `::Experimental` namespace will disappear and name `ROOT::TCanvasPainter` should be ok.

In a future PR, could you convert `TWebWindowsManager` to have static functions, instead of having to go through `Instance()->` all the time? These static functions can then call `TWebWindowsManagerImpl::Instance()->` but at least the interface is simpler. Would that be an option?

Generally speaking `TWebWindowsManager` is wrapper around `THttpServer` functionality.
And in multi-threaded environment I can imagine to have two (or more) independent instances of THttpServer for running different kinds of GUI elements. Probably, later we will provide interface to specify which window manager is used to create Canvas window(s)
Therefore for the moment I would keep interface as is - through `Instance()` and revise this functionality at the end.
